com.srch2.android.http.service

Class SearchableTerm

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.srch2.android.http.service.SearchableTerm

  • public final class SearchableTerm
extends Object
    The SearchableTerm encapsulates the search string with all the advanced search options. The default setting is copied from the IndexDescription User can call the setting functions to override the default settings.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  SearchableTerm.CompositeTerm
      The CompositeTerm that enable the boolean selection on the query terms.

    • Constructor Detail

      • SearchableTerm

        public SearchableTerm(String keywords)
        Creates the term into keyword. The string passed into this function is treated as a single search term. For example, if "George Lucas" is passed, the two words will be treated as one word.

        The prefix, fuzziness, boostValue is set using the default value present in IndexDescription

        Parameters:
        keywords -

        public SearchableTerm searchSpecificField(String fieldName)
